topics.name: What is React.js?
details: React.js is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, developed by Facebook and first released in 2013.
It allows developers to build reusable UI components and manage state efficiently.
React follows a declarative programming approach, making it easier to reason about UI updates.
React uses a virtual DOM to optimize rendering performance.
It supports both class-based and function-based components, with hooks introduced in React 16.8.
React is widely used for developing web applications, mobile apps (React Native), and even server-side rendering with Next.js.

topics.name: Why Use React?
details: React simplifies UI development with its component-based architecture.
It improves performance with its virtual DOM mechanism.
React provides unidirectional data flow, making state management predictable.
It has strong community support and a rich ecosystem of libraries.
React can be used to develop single-page applications (SPAs) and progressive web apps (PWAs).

topics.name: Setting Up the React Environment
details: Install Node.js and npm (Node Package Manager) to manage dependencies.
Use Create React App (CRA) for quickly setting up a React project.
Alternatively, set up a project manually using Webpack and Babel.
Use an IDE like VS Code with relevant extensions for better development experience.
Install dependencies using npm or yarn (e.g., `npm install` or `yarn`).
Run the React development server with `npm start` to preview your application.

topics.name: Hello World in React
details: The first step in learning React is creating a simple 'Hello World' component.
Create a new file `App.js` and define a functional component.
Use JSX (JavaScript XML) syntax to write UI elements inside JavaScript.
